results.title: The Natimuk Rock Climbers
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Louise Shepherd and Keith ‘Noddy’ Lockwood reminisce, tell anecdotes and reveal what makes a “mountain goat” tick, and how Mt Arapiles, in western Victoria, has shaped Natimuk’s destiny as an international destination for climbers.
results.description: Louise Shepherd and Keith ‘Noddy’ Lockwood reminisce, tell anecdotes and reveal what makes a “mountain goat” tick, and how Mt Arapiles, in western Victoria, has shaped Natimuk’s destiny as an international destination for climbers.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Horsham Shire
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Down Victoria’s Western Freeway, to the north of the Grampians, lie three towns that help to make up Horsham Shire. The towns of Horsham, Natimuk and Laharum are all from the same region, but, in meeting the locals, we get to see what truly makes these unique towns tick and why the locals wouldn’t want to live anywhere else.

results.title: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

video_links.name: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

results.brief_description:
Mark Rosenthal, curator of the ‘William Kentridge: Five Themes’ exhibition, joins world renowned artist and filmmaker William Kentridge in conversation days before the official opening of the exhibition. Kentridge talks about becoming an artist in the apartheid era of South Africa, how he developed his art practice and the importance of the studio as a place for safe stupidity.

This is a rare opportunity to hear one of the world’s most renowned moving image artists discuss his remarkable work.
results.title_for_label: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

results.title: Apple iPhone 3
results.brief_description: Smartphones like the Apple iPhone allow instantaneous recording and sharing of videos. Along with social media, they’ve helped establish and spread social and political movements, while filmmakers have also shot entire films on the portable devices.
results.description: The power to record, document, and film footage is now in everyone’s pocket. Mobile camera phones like those found in the Apple iPhone allow users to capture the world around them and share videos instantly. Along with the advent of social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, the camera phone was an important development in digital connectivity and the spread of social movements like the Arab Spring, Occupy Wall Street and Black Lives Matter. It has also become a modern tool for moviemaking, with filmmakers like Steven Soderbergh, Sean Baker, Jay Alvarez, Park Chan-wook and Michel Gondry shooting whole feature films with mobile cameras.
description_for_label: The power to record, document, and film footage is now in everyone’s pocket. Mobile camera phones like those found in the Apple iPhone allow users to capture the world around them and share videos instantly. Along with the advent of social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, the camera phone was an important development in digital connectivity and the spread of social movements like the Arab Spring, Occupy Wall Street and Black Lives Matter. It has also become a modern tool for moviemaking, with filmmakers like Steven Soderbergh, Sean Baker, Jay Alvarez, Park Chan-wook and Michel Gondry shooting whole feature films with mobile cameras.

results.title: MSX Sony ‘Hit Bit’ HB-75B game console and accessories
results.material_description: Video games console with game controllers. Does not include computer monitor. Comes in box with manuals and several magazine advertisements for the unit. Object display only and not functioning
results.brief_description: MSX Sony ‘Hit Bit’ HB-75B video games console. Black computer unit includes keyboard with overlay and adhesive label sheet. Also included are MSX-Basic Reference Chart, Operating Instructions, Programming Reference Manual, Introduction to MSX-Basic, ‘Match Maker’ advertising flyers, aerial/TV/Computer cable and original packaging box.

results.title: Famicom: Nintendo Family Computer HVC-001
results.material_description: Video game console with game controllers.  Includes original box with transformer, power cord and computer user manual. Object display only and not functioning
results.brief_description: Famicom Nintendo Family Computer HVC-001 video games console unit. Red and white plastic computer unit with two gaming controllers attached by black power cords. Controllers have ports designed to rest them either side of the unit. Console comes in original packaging (box) with RF switch, power cable and manual. The manual is written in foreign language
